China, India agree to maintain dialogue for peace in border area

Chinese and Indian border troops held a second round of talks at the level of corps commanders in the border area on June 22, and both agreed to keep up dialogue and work together for peace and tranquility on the ground along the border.

The national security law for HKSAR will fully respect and protect the various freedoms enjoyed by HK residents, as well as HK's judicial independence, says HKSAR Chief Executive Carrie Lam.
